intro: Angostylis, commonly known as the "Cape York lily," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its striking white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Angostylis has strap-like leaves that are often broad and lance-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is valued in horticulture for its beauty and ability to adapt to wet conditions.
